intro: Chaenactis rubricaulis, commonly known as the red-stemmed paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Compositae (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and dense clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to red, are pollinated primarily by insects. Chaenactis rubricaulis is a perennial species that produces achenes as its seed dispersal mechanism.
